39472870.review: The idea was fantastic and by and large so was the implementation. Really nice graphics. Lacked full 360 degree rotation in parts so you try to pan round and end up sweeping off to the side instead. The puzzles were a bizarre and often not at all intuitive. Had me looking at the walk through several times because I just couldn't figure out what was required. The typewriter clock thing .. just awful. How could anyone figure that out and even after looking at the walk through it was still darn near impossible. Puts me off a replay to be honest which is a shame because it's a great narrative. I found myself floundering for what to do next way too much as well. Sometimes you'd know something had opened but the game doesn't show you where. But, all that said, it's a great game with an awesome story and the detail of da Vinci's inventions etc is genius. Get it.

39419262.review:
Animations parfaites, 3D irréprochable et fluide, graphismes de toute beauté et décors sonores agréables, jamais envahissants. Que du bonheur ! Quant au jeu - car c'est un jeu en même temps qu'une promenade - il est captivant sans être trop complexe (bouclé en un peu plus de 3 heures, cool). J'aurai plaisir à refaire le parcours et m'attarder sur les détails, en attendant la suite bien sûr...
Bravo aux éditeurs et graphistes !

all in all.

A very intriguing game. Well worth the cost in my opinion. I did wonder at one point whethet the action would ever finish, as I was led from one chamber to another.

The "puzzles" varied from fairly straightforward to fiendish, but the graphics are so good that it was a pleasure to be involved.

Those gamers who enjoy "The Room" will be pleased with this one. I recommend it to serous players.

I must give credit to the yoing French player who provided me with some useful pointers in his/her walkthrough.

I když se mi nepodařilo pochopit hříčku s písmeny v části s astrolábem, tak jsem se dobře bavil. Použité prostředky jsou opravdu jako by byly z dob Leonarda a stroje obsahující hlavolamy jsou opravdu jako by byly vytvořeny Leonardem.
Moc jsem se pobavil. Ne každá hra mě donutí sundat Oculus s Elite Dangerous a hrát ve 2D. Pánové autoři gratuluji a děkuji za tuto hru. Vřele ji doporučuji všem.

40698781.review: 跟 the room根本没法比

40671567.review: Fantastic Game!! One of the best pozzle games ever!! A+++ DO NOT MISS THIS GAME!!

40621966.review:
We've waited for the longest time for Fireproof Games to polish up the next iteration of The Room for Steam, and this game filled the void quite nicely.
The playstyle and graphics are very similar to The Room where you click on stuff to make stuff happen so you can get to the next area with more stuff, all the while wondering "how did he fit all those contraptions in there?"

I only had one tiny complaint, and it was due to running into a glitch where some animation didn't load, preventing me from accessing a piece of the puzzle, but that was fixed by reloading the save.

All in all, if you liked The Room, or you like atmospheric puzzle games, you'll probably like this one.  Great job, devs, I look forward to the sequel!

40616778.review: 5 hours of great puzzle fun. Controls are easy, and the graphics are marvelous.

40599376.review:
emmmm.。。。游戏时间不长，大概7、8个小时就能通关。游戏类型与the room非常的相似，解密非常简单，没有过于烧脑的谜题。剧情方面非常担保，就有人要追杀他拿到他手里的时间机器和其他发明，非常的牵强。故事也没结尾，最后见到刺客带着面具，和没见到一个样，然后跳进时空机器也是标准剧情，重要的是跳进去之后只有一句话，什么结尾都没有。
和喜欢the room的玩家可以考虑入手，但是如果是被剧情吸引进来的可以放弃了。

40587172.review:
Very nice puzzle game.

Navigation through the game is sort of 3D. You navigate through the world by double clicking on Points of Interest. You can look around with the mouse from that point and interact with objects.
I liked that there was not visible hint (like some fancy glowing) where the next interaction point ist. Of course if you cannot think of the next step you can search for the interactions with the mouse. The mouse cursor will change, when you can interact.

There are a couple of hints you can use, if you get stuck. They don't spoil too much, usually the first hint is where the next puzzle is located. Example: Look at the wall to the right of the entrance. And the last hint will tell you what to do in the puzzle in general, but won't tell you the actual answer.

It was fun to play, although a few puzzles really get me press Alt+F4 as I was not clever enough to solve the puzzles quickly. Most of the time it was some kind of 3x3 tiles where you need to move the tiles into the correct position. I hate those puzzles ;)

Never-the-less, a very enjoyable game. Took me around 5 hours according to the final screen. Recommended, if you are a fan of puzzles.

40564552.review:
Просто замечательная  игра - гимнастика для мозга. Море удовольствия от решения загадок Леонардо! Плюс еще связано все сюжетом. Отличная графика и хорошо подобранный саунтрек. Голова сначала кипит от поисков, и такой кайф после решения очередной головоломки. Купила по скидке и не охотно начала проходить. А игра реально затянула!  Советую всем любителям подобного жанра! Еще раз огромная благодарность всем кто принимал участие в создании игры. Ждем продолжения!

P.S. В игре все достижения можно просмотреть и попробоватьв деле! Очень интересная задумка!  10/10

40531145.review: Потрясающая игра! Сидели вместе с мужем, не могли оторваться. Антураж, загадки, прохождение - супер)

40521573.review: This is a very good game. The clues are not readily available and you cannot skip any part of the game. One thing that did get a little annoying was that the first clue was so basic, but then I suppose that the game is meant to be for all ages. I like tthe hidden clues like scratches on wook for instance. I gives you a sense of accomplishment when you figure it our and I feel quite proud for having completed it. I cannot wait for the next one!

40502617.review:
So delighted with this game. It took me back to my Myst and Riven days, oddly even more so than Cyan's own Obduction did. The artwork is beautiful, textures are rich, and the mechanisms are so very clever.  The old Italian font on the letters looked like one of my favorites from the Scriptorium, and big points for attention to detail throughout the game. The puzzles ranged from easy to complex but no frustrating ones. Loved the immersive atmosphere and just the enjoyment of a classic point and click puzzle game that is well done. 

Wasn't too fond of the ending, but heyho.  Also the Occuli on the PC could be a bit touchy here and there, but overall was fine.  Enjoyed going back to the Achievment courtyard and tinkering with each of the inventions there. Very nice touch! Would really like to see more games like this from Blue Brain Games.

40502535.review: Thoroughly enjoyable puzzle game. I had a blast. Thank you Rania for showing this on stream! o/

40485430.review: Very nice game, addicting and great!! I hope there will be a next one coming!

40476913.review: absolutey loved it. the game wasnt to long but it was very fun. the puzzles wernt to difficult or frustrating they were just right . really wish steam had more puzzle games like this.

40472527.review: It's a nice puzzle. It wass not to easy and not to hard if you use your eyes ;D

40462581.review: Интересные загадки и приятная атмосфера. Мне понравилось.

40451764.review:
I absolutely loved this game! Yes, it's quite short but for a puzzle game that really makes me work and think. I mean, of course I would have loved it to be longer but I didn't do it all in one go - I can't concentrate for that long for a start.

Pros

- Gorgeous art style
- Puzzles involve effort but mostly aren't impossible
- Good storyline
- Achievements have their own little area so make collecting them worthwhile
- Controls are easy to use

Cons

- Camera can be annoying to control and sometimes doesn't want to go where you want it to
- There are still a few bugs and I had to go back to the main menu and continue the game again to fix things a couple of times
- Quite short
- Occasionally things are a little too hidden, which I found frustrating

Despite the cons, I still really loved this game, and would give it 9 out of 10.

40440200.review: 看了夫人的视频才知道的这款游戏  对于我这种不常玩推理游戏的玩家而言 实在有些难了  不过视频通关过一次后 自己没找攻略6个半小时也通关了  很不错的游戏  期待开发人员再接再厉。

40431609.review: Absolutely fantastic game. The execution of various puzzles and build-ups are great. Story is a bit meh, but it's mainly a puzzle game anyways. 8/10

The Room重度沉迷患者必备
好喜欢这种机械解谜游戏啊(ノ｀Д)ノ

越往后越觉得比不上the room了
很多地方的解密非常复杂又非常牵强，根本不像the room系列的解密过程那样逻辑严密令人愉悦
就连很多提示都指代不明令人觉得似懂非懂，反正我还翻了好几次别人的通关视频
操作手感非常僵硬，往往点a跳到b，点b又没反应
不是考眼力找道具的谜题，就是没有乐趣的复杂的类似华容道之类的游戏，解密体验非常一般
以及明明都看出来道具是什么怎么用了，剧情设置偏偏要求跟其他部件组合了才能用，感觉自己被开发者当成了智障

40282326.review: Got this on sale when it was 13 dollars I belive. Now its back to 19.99 dollars, for me its not worth that high. If you are gonna get this game get it on sale. Its a great game just like the Room, however the camera does tend be finiky at times. Also  one time for me a puzzle was abscude due to the camera. Great game though.

40269636.review:
Like many others are saying, this is very similar to The Room and its sequel...but that's a good thing.

What makes this better than The Room is the excellent homage to Da Vinci's inventions. The puzzle design is very reminiscent of Da Vinci, and the art is gorgeous.

Some of the puzzles are surprising...challenging enough to be fun but not frustratingly difficult. 

I loved The Room games, I love this, and if they make more like it, I will keep buying them until the end of time.

Deserves 'overwhelmingly positive' IMO.

40266839.review: Excelente juego todo un reto para los que gustan resolver acertijos

40241490.review: It feels like playing another the room great and its amazing. I wish they would do more of these.

40241246.review: Just as many have said before, if you liked The Room/The Room 2, you'll like this one. No, it's not perfect, as there are many times you can tell it wasn't completely optimized for a mouse: camera control and manipulation of items that just don't work very well (looking at the astrolabe in particular). However, these issues are more annoyances than detriments to progress. It's a pretty game with good puzzles, though I really wish it would've been longer, both due to the price point AND due to the fact that I was enjoying myself and simply didn't want the game to end yet. Regardless, I'm looking forward to more like this (i.e. The House of Da Vinci 2), but will definitely be looking into anything similar that Blue Brain Games brings along in the future.

40237312.review: Świetna gra na rozwijanie logicznego myślenia, naukę spostrzegawczości i jest idealna dla fanów łamigłówek występujących w Escape Roomach. W moim odczuciu zakończenie jest mało klimatyczne... ale może to kwestia gustu :)

40230101.review: Stesse meccaniche di The Room ma con tutte le invenzioni e lo stile di Leonardo Da Vinci. Sembra di entrare nel suo laboratorio ed esplorare le sue idee. La sfida è assicurata, ci sono enigmi davvero ben congegnati ma mai impossibili grazie al sistema di aiuti.

40228962.review:
Good methodical puzzles for the most part, not always explained very well. I found the lighting to be a genuine hinderance, often could not see parts of the puzzle.
Sometimes the puzzles dont make sense. "use this to open a door that could have been opened by hand" - no lock mechanism.
People compare it to The Room, yes comparable to the room but more expensive and on PC.
Very easy to get sucked in, nice and relaxing, however would question value for money and would love a brightness setting.

40214902.review: Excellent game.....Good graphics...Hope there's more to come....

40151951.review:
“你已证明你拥有开阔的死路。”

然后就是操作手感真的很一般，谜题略显简单无聊，无奈偏爱这类解谜游戏，还是值得尝试游玩的。

40142135.review: This is the next step in puzzle games.  Afer playing many adventure type puzzle games (Myst, Riven, Quern, Obduction, etc), this is just straight puzzles with a story line put together to sew them together.  Sure, some won't like the ending but isn't the journey what matters?  Great graphics and ambience!  Good storyline.  Lasted longer than its rivals - The Room and The Room Two.  Sure to please if you are in a thinking mood - great hints for those who get stumped.

40136056.review: Mükemmel bir oyun bulmaca severler için kesinlikle tavsiye ederim [tavsiye geçemediğiniz bölümleri mutlaka uraşın geçin yoksa hiçbir zevki kalmaz...)

40115009.review: The House of Da Vinci is an incredibly satisfying game for anybody who is looking for a relaxing puzzle game. While challenging, this game sets the difficulty just right and avoids some of the aspects of other puzzle games that end with the player being frustrated and having a headache. The hint system does a great job for players who are not adept at this type of game, giving just enough information to point in the right direction but not so much that it makes things blatantly obvious. Additionally, the graphics and story wind together in a way that makes the player feel that they're really working towards something, rather than just solving an endless chain of puzzles. 10/10

40113110.review:
Kann man das Spiel grafisch ernsthaft mit den the room Teilen auf eine Stufe stellen?
Da muss man ja was am Auge haben. Runde Objekte sind eher 8-eckig, bestenfalls 16-eckig.
Sieht aus wie eine 1:1 Handy Adaption. Licht und Schattenspiele, genial bei the room, hier gar nix.
Ob das gameplay gut ist, kann ich nicht beurteilen, das erste langweilige Schieberätsel mit hakeliger Steuerung in Kombination mit der grottigen Grafik haben mich zum schnellen Not-Aus animiert.

40092678.review: A fabulous game. Lots of interesting puzzles and a perfect hint system, only giving away a little at a time. I thoroughly enjoyed this game and will play it again in the future.

39996549.review:
Доброго времени суток. Прошёл игру и решил оставить свой отзыв.
 Все кто любит игры данного жанра, наверно ещё помнят The Room и The Room 2. 
Очень похожая подача, приятная графика и звук. В The House of Da Vinci так же можно встретить знакомый приём из серии игр The Room, использование доп. линз, которые дают возможность видеть знаки или события происходивщие в прошлом.
 The House of Da Vinci приятная игра-головоломка средней сложности с вкраплением сюжета. =) Рекомендую любителям жанра, можно смело брать со скидкой. 

Ложка дёгтя: за всё время прохождения было два момента, когда после решение задачи, не происходило действие (баг), дающие возможность продвинуться дальше. =/ (Решение проблемы есть, надо просто выйти в главное меню и снова продолжить игру).

39990420.review: Very nice puzzle game in the style of The Room and it's sequel. All puzzles are logical, some requiring trial and error.

39988181.review: A great game! It reminds so much of The Room, but so much more!  There are cutscenes, mind-blowing puzzles, and unanswered questions! I hope they make a squal to this amazing game, becuase at the end, I was asking for more!

39986342.review: mega cooles spiel hoffentlich gibt es irgendwann mehr solcher spiele

39984748.review:
对于The Room系列拙劣的模仿……
目前玩下来，谜题不难，真的超简单，但是！这尼玛对于星际玩家来说太困难了吧！The Room 系列关于寻找线索还是很友好的，谜题和逻辑的推理才是重点……但是这个游戏叫什么鬼啊！判定点迷得一匹，机关藏在莫名其妙的地方，强行靠着因为看不到而延长卡关时间和一不当心瞎点点出线索来给玩家恍然大悟的感觉，差评！所谓层层叠叠的关卡嵌套根本就没有逻辑！
头一次因为玩个解谜游戏差点把鼠标丢出去(╯‵□′)╯︵┻━┻
但是因为没有其他类The Room系列的游戏而咬着牙准备继续玩而不是退款……有种冷CP坑底凉得不行，难得有人割了腿肉于是饿疯了地饥不择食的即视感……怎么这么凄凉呢_(:з」∠)_

39981531.review:
[h1]未来而来的鉴赏家，慕名而来观赏著名艺术家的杰出作品，不料看到的却是失败品。[/h1]
						——打完《达芬奇房子》之后的感想。

如果不想看下面那段评论的话，直接告诉结论：[spoiler]别花大价钱买这游戏！去玩《THE ROOM》性价比和游戏性更好！[/spoiler]

=========================================================================

事先说明，确实是先玩过《THE ROOM》1和2之后，因为迟迟未有《THE ROOM》3移植PC版登录STEAM平台，所以看到同类型的这个《达芬奇房子》的游戏就买来玩了。

很明显的在游玩过程中会发现很多雷同于《THE ROOM》的痕迹，比如说那个镜片，比如说不少机关道具的造型什么的。据称《THE ROOM》的成员有参与过这游戏的制作，就当作这么回事好了。

[b]所以下面的主观判断会拿这游戏和《THE ROOM》来做对比，敬请谅解。[/b]

1.剧情讲述差。
玩家应约而来达芬奇家，切换章节时身后总会有声音或者人影，最后掉进时间隧道里END了。大致上就是这么个糊里糊涂的故事。一路上只看见达芬奇留下的信件。全程忙着找道具解谜呢哪有空理会达芬奇和自己的死活。
惊悚感觉不足，紧张感不足，烦躁感倒是有剩。

2.过场CG粗糙。
噢天哪，亲爱的达芬奇先生，看在上帝的份上，序章那僵硬的仆从和飞下塔的怪兽还有结局时刺杀过来的刺客，真是活见鬼了，为什么不多找一些更好的演员替换他们，真心为那粗糙的演技感到悲伤。

3.切换镜头的移动问题。
看看别的评论，都会说这个问题。

4.镜片和时间视野的参与度不足。
比起《THE ROOM》那让人惊艳的镜片谜题设计（1代最后那镜中操作和2代最后的满屋子绿字），《达芬奇房子》的谜题更多情况下都是【找道具】为主，而不是解谜为主。《达芬奇房子》谜题里有一半以上是【旋转】和【插销】为内容，甚至你得到的道具还要点开来接插拧转一下才算能用的。
举个不太恰当的形容，《THE ROOM》是把难度适中的问题写在纸上，然后把纸折成纸模让玩家去解答，答题文具放在显眼的地方或者放在纸模里。《达芬奇房子》就是把简单问题写在满屋子隐蔽的角落里，把笔套上笔帽或者笔芯笔身分开藏起来让玩家去找。就这么种感觉。

优点还是有的，感官最好的场景是第二关的模型投石车点灯场景，和第四关的骑士盔甲石棺材场景。如果算的话，成就馆的场景也很不错。


当玩通整个正篇的游戏，进成就馆看到收集回来6个成就图纸的成品——印刷机、锉销床、风管琴、振翼机、回转桥、割草机。[u]从21世纪的现代人的角度来看[/u]，全部都是有瑕疵或者很不实用的成品。每个作品都能指出很多不足的地方，甚至还能用实际现有的成品例子来说明更好的方案。
——以【后人的眼光】来指指点点【先行者】的作品，瑕疵当然数不胜数。
——就如同拿《THE ROOM》或者别的更好的密室游戏来指责《达芬奇房子》的缺点一样。
所以才会有开头那一句话。
[strike]花大价钱买了达芬奇博物馆的门票，花了几小时找出口+顺带参观作品，心里催眠自己就是这么玩了这个游戏得了。[/strike]

39958405.review: Great game, though puzzeles and thrilling story. Really enjoyed this one!

39938782.review:
Na dann komme ich der Aufforderung doch gerne nach, das Spiel zu bewerten. Als sofortiger Fan der beiden "The Room" Spiele konnte ich den Da Vinci Rätseln nicht widerstehen, denn anderen Berichten zur Folge soll es ja exakt dasselbe Prinzip sein. 
Kurz: ja, das ist es! Und doch ist es im weiteren Verlauf einen Tick anders. Das hat gute, aber auch nicht ganz so gute Seiten. Warum ich das so sehe, versuche ich nun zu erklären.
Zuerst mal spielt das Szenario zur Zeit Da Vincis, der dem Spieler sein Haus voller Rätsel und Geheimnisse überlässt und ihn auf seine Spuren schickt. Wie schon in The Room wird die Handlung mit Ausnahme der Intro-Sequenz und kleinen Zwischensequenzen nur in Form von Briefen erzählt, welche man in jedem Raum vorfindet und die einen näher an das große Ziel heranführen. 
Während es in den Vorbild-Spielen allerdings eher darum ging, trickreich verschlossene Truhen, Kisten oder andere Behälter zu öffnen, hat man hier immer mindestens einen Raum, den man komplett in die Rätselei einbezieht. Acuh hier gibt es meist ein zentrales Element, das die Aufmerksamkeit des Spielers auf sich zieht, doch man beschäftigt sich häufig eher mit der restlichen Umgebung - will heißen: man hat im Grunde ein Point&Click Adventure im Stil von Myst, aber in einem räumlich engeren Rahmen und mit Apparaten, die technisch durchaus denkbar sind (zu den Ausnahmen komme ich noch)
Per Doppelklick zoomt man an definierten Stellen ins Detail und kann eventuell mit linker Maustaste interagieren (drücken, ziehen, drehen, Dinge aufnehmen). Hat man Gegenstände im Inventar, kann man diese näher untersuchen und auch daran evemntuell noch mal Veränderungen vornehmen oder sie mit anderen Gegenständen kombinieren. 
Hat man ein Rätsel gelöst, ist der entsprechende Ort nicht mehr interaktiv und man weiß, dass man an der Stelle nichts mehr zu tun hat. 
Wie bei The Room hat man auch in diesem Spiel ein Okkular, das aber zwei Funktionen hat und es kommt noch ein Magnethandschuh hinzu (mit dem zumindest ein paar Dinge physikalisch besser erklärbar sind). Das Okkular kann entweder bestimmte Stellen durchdringen und dem Spieler wie in einem Röntgenbild das Innenleben präsentieren oder man kann an vorgegebenen Orten in Stück weit die Schatten der Vergangenheit beleben und sieht so beispielsweise, wie Schalterstellungen anzuordnen sind. 
Das alles klingt jetzt erst mal nach viel Komplexität und tatsächlich dauert es hier einen Moment, bis man sich in einem neuen Zimmer orientiert hat. Dann jedoch kommt man den meisten Aufgaben mit reiner Logik Stück für Stück auf die Schliche und die Motivation steigt. Für Abwechlsung ist gesorgt, indem kleine Minispiele, wie das Bewegen eines Objekt durch ein flexibles Labyrinth oder ein kleines Strategiespiel eingeflochten werden. Zudem sorgt ein Hilfesystem mit bis zu vier Tipps für ein recht gutes Durchkommen.
Doch jetzt komme ich genau an der Stelle zu einem kritischen Punkt, den ich in The Room gar nicht und im zweiten Teil nur einmal erlebt habe: manchmal verkommt das Spiel leider etwas zum Trial and Error, was ich an einem Beispiel erläutern will, das so ähnlich im Spiel vorkommt, aber aus Spoilergründen hier leicht verändert beschrieben wird: ich untersuche einen Schrank, öffne eine Tür und eine Schublade und verlasse dann den Raum, um nebenan weiterzumachen. Dann bleibe ich hängen, da mir ein wichtiger Gegenstand fehlt. Der zweite oder dritte Tipp bringt mich dann auf die Idee, den Schrank noch mal zu untersuchen, an dem plötzlich eine neue Stelle aktiv geworden ist und ein Geheimfach offenbart, das zuvor noch nicht geöffnet werden konnte geschweige denn, dass es einen Hinweis darauf gegeben hätte, dass es überhaupt da ist. 
Und das passiert nicht nur einmal, sondern im letzten Drittel sehr häufig. Man bleibt selten hängen, weil man das Rätsel nicht durchschaut, sondern, weil man nicht noch mal jedes Detail und jeden Winkel absucht. Da die Räume später größer werden und sich auch über Etagen erstrecken, ist das reines Ausprobieren und trübt den Spaß, denn ohne Hinweis geht es nur dann, wenn man weiß, dass man am besten in jeder Perspektive jedes Objekt noch mal heranzoomt, weil da plötzlich was neues möglich sein könnte. 
Dennoch: es bleibt alles in einem logischen Rahmen, wenn man die wenigen SciFi Elemente akzeptieren kann und die Momente, in denen man ein Rätsel entwirrt hat, sind unvergleichlich. 
Die Präsentation ist sehr gut, alles sieht sauber und technisch plausibel aus und auch die Vertonung kann sich hören lassen. Der Soundtrack schankt zwischen melancholischer Atmosphäre im Talos-Prinzip-Stil und gruseliger Streichermusik. Getrieben von der Handlung und einem unheimlichen Verfolger fühlt sich hier auch alles etwas bedrohlicher und spannender an. 
Der Umfang ist deutlich höher als es bei The Room der Fall ist (ungefähr das Dreifache würde ich sagen) und durch die unterschiedlichen Szenarien auch extrem abwechslungsreich. Selbst in Räumen, wie dem Garten, die auf den ersten Blick nicht viel herzugeben scheinen, zeigen sich toll gestaltete und vertrackte Rätsel. Das Einfallsreichtum der Macher ist enorm. 
Fazit: wer Exit Spiele mag, wer The Room und sein Nachfolger mag, wer Myst oder Grafikadventures mag und wer Spaß an Rätseln und Knobeln hat und einen logisch arbeitenden Verstand mitbringt, darf hier bedenkenlos zugreifen. Der angepsrochene Kritikpunkt bleibt zwar, doch er hindert nicht so sehr, dass das Spiel wirklich darunter leidet. 
Wer nicht sicher ist, sollte zum ersten The Room greifen, da es recht günstig zu haben und das Prinzip exakt dasselbe ist. Und wenn man danach "mehr von allem" haben will, darf man sich diesen Wunsch hier erfüllen, denn hier gibt es von allem mehr viel mehr. Gerne noch mehr davon....

39935885.review: Amazing set of witful puzzles I've had a great time solving. Thumbs up for all escape game fans.

39930324.review: 这游戏是不错的，就是第二章快完的时候就直接给我卡BUG，重新玩一样卡着，怎么都互动不了，心真的好累！痛苦！

39927370.review:
I wanted to love this game because I love puzzle games. But some puzzles towards the end game are incredibly difficult with so little clues, making it completely non-intuitive. Because of this, it makes House of Da Vinci more of a guessing, trial-and-error game. If it weren't for the original and fun story, the game would be just a poor rip off of The Room, it is less polished and non-intuitive. Some rooms and chapters go on for far too long, driven only by having to travel back and forth to finish the main area. 

Also, we have got to talk about the hints. The hints often repeat, but in different terms, the same direction. So when that little blue light flashes and you feel like finally relief is coming, think again. 

All in all, tthis game would have been amazing with better textures and more intuitive puzzles. Story alone carried this game.

39922141.review:
[h1][url=store.steampowered.com/app/522470/The_House_of_Da_Vinci/]The House of Da Vinci[/url] shamelessly copies The Room's winning formula, compelling mechanics and material aesthetics, and sets them in a new time period with few innovations and good results.[/h1]

The exploration flawlessly starts out as another entry in its inspirational predecessor's series, with the first intriguing contraptions contained in controlled areas. The Renaissance theme and Leonardo da Vinci's work in particular are both very appropriate here.

Keen observation and deduction lead the way to satisfyingly logical solutions. Retrieve keys, locate missing gears, reassemble parts, activate machinery, unhook locks, slide, rotate, pull, combine, connect, reveal, align. The game's puzzles and environments are fairly executed and generally polished with few exceptions.

The level of complexity quickly escalates and some puzzles eventually spread over much larger areas. This expansion tends to de-focus interactions more than make the world feel grander but the game retains the same enjoyable general vibe.

[h1]"Watch for the unusual, perceive the extraordinary, keep your mind awake and your eyes opened."[/h1]

Puzzles felt progressively less intuitive as I moved forward, particularly the tank hatch lock (where players must set metal rods in positions that still appear illogically locked) and the astrolabe's absurd metal dial (which still makes no sense to me even after completing the game).

Special lenses reveal hidden mechanisms or past events. These mechanics are both underused and overused.

The former forces the player to double-check every scene with the lenses to see if they missed anything. This felt like a tacked on way of obtaining hidden hints rather than satisfying sleuthing.

The lens' other ability lets the player view minute flashbacks that essentially reveal a combination of moves to replicate. It's like following a walkthrough but shown directly as an in-game overlay. Both mechanics could have been used much more effectively.

[h1]Positive[/h1]
[list]
[*] Nice audio and visual weightiness to worn wood and metallic objects
[*] Game generally looks good, though almost entirely orange and brown (sometimes blue)
[*] Helpful hint system points out overlooked areas
[*] The better clever puzzles feel extremely rewarding
[*] Enjoyable exploration without pressure
[*] A very good game in a sadly underrepresented genre
[*] Collect optional interactive machines based on actual Da Vinci inventions or blueprints
[/list]

[h1]Negative[/h1]
[list]
[*] Imperfect controls sometimes rotate the view instead of the piece you're trying to move
[*] Puzzles spanning multiple rooms sometimes lack focus
[*] Unrealized marginal story with lame, inconclusive ending
[*] Some noticeably low resolution textures
[*] A few puzzles lack apparent or reasonable logic
[*] Hint system sometimes just plainly states the obvious (typically the less intuitive ones when needed the most)
[/list]

me ha encantado de principio a fin puzzles muy bien diseñados con un par de mecanicas asi novedosas muy chulas y todo bastante bien explicado, todo puzzle tiene su logica y todas las pistas necesarias estan a la vista a nada mas que te fijas un poco, eso si imprescindible desactivar en opciones de menu las 'pistas' y lo pongo entre comillas por que mas que pistas es un directamente haz esto o lo otro, una gran cagada que tienen todos estos tipos de juegos modernos de meter opcion de pistas en la interfaz, eso le quita totalmente el encanto al juego, aun asi se agradece que almenos se puedan desactivar, el juego no tiene una dificultad alta vas de sobra sin que te lleven de la mano, quizas un par de puzzles al final que te puedes atascar pero al final sale, siempre sale ;) ....

39777126.review:
TL;DR:
Okay graphics, repetetive music, some alright puzzles, more bad puzzles, occasionally dark as f*ck, go with The Room instead.

As a fan of The Room series, I though I was in for a treat. I was wrong.

Controlling your actions feels flimsy as you you occasionally end up looking around instead of doing the action you wanted to do and making the puzzles span out to several rooms at makes it feel disconnected. Even moving around feels bad because all you can do is "zoom in and out" from the elements and rooms (think it like positions you can go that are just branched out), especially when a puzzles uses several rooms.

The worst parts about this game however are sadly some of the puzzles themselves. With the way how they're layed out, you'll end up running around trying to find where some puzzle piece goes, which then builds up frustration. More than a few times I was straight up stuck, did know what was I supposed to do as none of the items I had didn't fit anywhere. Then it's just something along the lines of: "Haha, it's a hidden button that blends in to the wall!" And even sadder is the fact that apparently Leonarda da-fucking-Vinci was a fan of SLIDE PUZZLES.

Just... no. Graphics were alright (except for the sh*tload of darkness + you apparently forget that you picked up a torch at the end of one puzzle) but music was repetetive.

Just stick with The Rooms.

39667477.review: Pěkné, věrohodné prostředí Florencie. Oceňuji, jak byly využity technologie a vynálezy, které mistr Leonardo opravdu zkonstruoval a také některé odkazy na historické osobnosti 15.-16. století. Hra na mě působila příjemným dojmem, logické úlohy byly přiměřené a hra navíc nebyla dlouhá tak, aby člověka začala nudit. Klidná hudba vás vtáhne do děje a zároveň vás neruší při řešení úloh. Jako negativa bych zmínil slabý a nic neříkající příběh a hlavně ten konec, ten mě docela zklamal, nebylo zde žádné vygradované vyústění, ba dokonce vysvětlení a chyběl mi i nějaký ten rozhovor s Leonardem osobně.

39659890.review: super jeu mais certaines énigmes sont un peu tordues autrement bonne ambiance , j'ai passé un très bon moment.

39636563.review:
I have the game loaded into my Samsung Tab S2 for when I travel & want to play it. For some reason the game/tablet have a hard time responding to the the single/double taps.
However, I do love the game on my PC & look forward to many more of your games.
EW

39611766.review:
This puzzler is thoughtful, well-illustrated, extremely atmospheric and overall was fun to go through. 
The lack of satisfying conclusion to the 'story' was disappointing.
It was fun to see some of da Vinci's inventions given life, so to speak.
The pricetag, however, feels just a bit high ( $20/9hrs to finish=$2/hr ).

Regardless, if you see this game on sale, buy it. It's definitely worth it.

39578341.review: trop cour à mon gout mais superbement bien réaliser

39570137.review: Déçu, le jeu en lui meme est super, les énigmes ne sont pas aussi faciles que l'on pourrait le croire, mais le temps de jeu pour une personne qui connait deja ce genre d'énigme est assez court, j'ai payé ce jeu 19.99 pour 5h et 1 minute de jeu, le jeu Quern de Zadbox Entertainment qui ce fix au alentour du meme prix prend plus de temps à la reflexion et donc plus de temps de jeu. j'ai mis autant de temps sur The house of da Vinci que sur les 2 The ROOM disponible sur STEAM, qui eux m'ont couté beaucoup moins cher (les deux réunis).

39561485.review:
玩儿了这么多解谜游戏，从来没有玩过这么让人来气的。

先夸再抽嘴巴子。
优点
①设定很不错，作为人类史上最杰出的天才达芬奇身上也有不少谜题，游戏的各种内容也十分贴合主题，没有特别突出的硬伤。
②画面和音乐非常好，很赏心悦目。
③老有黑影追着你感觉好怕怕好吃鸡哦！(*。>Д<)o゜
缺点
①非常特别及其以至于根本不想再玩下去地繁琐。
有些需要动脑子的益智题要过上五次甚至七次才算过关。（比如星象仪那块的跳方格）这样类型的题目最多三次足以，多了就会让人失去对游戏的兴趣和耐心，降低效率。
②某些地方本来想要点击物品却在点击后跳到别的区域，非常让人上头。强烈建议修改星象台关卡星象仪附近的双击区域。
③CG即使是通关后也不能跳过，非常浪费时间。我知道游戏是想让效果完整一些，大概是我耐心太低因为别的部分消耗掉了我大部分的耐心所以这块更会让我恼火。
④需要鼠标大范围旋转的地方太多。这种设置在手机上大概还好一些，但是PC实际玩过之后就会发现有些物体必须要将视角调整到某一角度才能用鼠标移开。（我知道你是想学[spoiler]THE ROOM[/spoiler]但是你也学的好一点啊……）建议设置单击后反应的装置更多一些。
⑤毫无意义的重复太多。[spoiler]i.e 在最后一章你需要向点火器里加入瓦斯。但瓦斯需要用完全手动的气泵一点一点充气，而且顺序如果错误就要重新装填气体。一共六个点火器，如果点错了里面的火就会熄灭，越到后面灭得越多=你需要充的气越多=你需要一下下充气的次数就越多。运气好一点可能没那么多次，但是我起码充了10次以上的气才搞定。气得我感觉我才是那个点火器当时就想砸键盘了。[/spoiler]
⑥有些地方会莫名其妙地过关。我有些地方到现在都不知道自己是怎么过的，不知道提示在哪里。还有些地方的提示其实根本就没有用处，或者根本是在误导。[spoiler]i.e ①最后一关的锅炉里面会有三排数字，需要得到显微镜里图形的数量。这里完全没有具体提示反正我一开始很久都没想到。并且小飞机上是会给你提示的，顺序是正方形（八面体）x2，八边形（十二面体）x4，三角形（四面体）x8，然后旁边有其他配套的图形。我一直以为是按照这个顺序来做结果到死也只能做出428，结果最后却是要将图形按照上面的数字排列。你特么是在逗我吗把我半个小时人生还给我啊。②最后一关，传统的量杯解谜，哪里都没有看到提示，莫名其妙弄出中间四格之后就过关了。虽然我过了但是我非常想知道这里的如果有提示的话在哪里= =[/spoiler]
⑦到后面的章节眼镜的作用越来越少。需要平衡一下。

差不多如此。感觉是一款[spoiler]模仿THE ROOM系列[/spoiler]比较奇幻风格的解谜游戏。但是相比而言差劲的地方太多，再加上我自己耐心不足游戏体验非常差。但画面效果来说还是不错的，有耐心的同志们可以尝试。

39556673.review: Super logika moc mě to bavilo :-)
